ai-mil5.5.6:0.4_0: the lord of the earthquakes, (but) from the ground.
ai-mil5.5.6:1.1_0: “Venerable Sir, when you heard what the Buddha said,
ai-mil5.5.6:2.2_0: the hermits’ banner, having slaughtered the seer,
ai-mil5.5.6:2.4_0: Flowly, he is burning; all of them is burning.’
ai-mil5.5.6:3.2_0: ‘Kassapa, he abused the Buddha Kassapa, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha. He abuses and insults him with rude, harsh words.’
ai-mil5.5.6:3.3_0: When an elephant’s intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, he uttered a falsehood, for he is the ascetic Kassapa.
ai-mil5.5.6:3.4_0: whether the Buddha Kassapa is conquered by ascetics, brahmins, merchants, and workers.
ai-mil5.5.6:3.5_0: What if, when Bodhisatta was struck with a pearl, having made known to the Bodhi (Tree) in this way, why, the Bodhisatta lion, the instrument of the world, having made a planned the spot for the reception of the Bodhisatta lake, decorated the Great Snakes.
ai-mil5.5.6:3.6_0: This question too should be excited by a question of both sides.
ai-mil5.5.6:4.1_0: when the Buddha has said this: ‘Great king, the royal dragon kings governed the sky.’ ...
ai-mil5.5.6:4.3_0: Kassapa, the Jotipāla, who is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in shave like a poisonous snake, shaven-headed, mixed with harsh words. And he is not angry and distrustful.
ai-mil5.5.6:4.4_0: Jotipāla, the brahmin student Jotipāla, son of the Dāsaka, and his parents, say to them: ‘Now, Ghaṭīkāra, go forth from a good family,’ he invited them to ask, ‘That young brahmin.’
ai-mil5.5.6:4.5_0: ‘What’s the use of seeing that baldy, that fake ascetic?’
ai-mil5.5.6:5.1_0: And just as the deathless (rough the deathless) heat is going to the buttocks by fire.
ai-mil5.5.6:5.2_0: In the same way, great king, Jotipāla did not respond to the faithless family tradition by the Realized One, calling him a dreadful racket.
ai-mil5.5.6:6.1_0: Suppose a blazing fire was burning on a blazing grass torch, and glowing. The fire would burn up.
ai-mil5.5.6:6.2_0: In the same way, Jotipāla the student, Jotipāla, because of faith and confidence, having become faithful and elated, questioning him with his own insight and responsiveness to the family, as if he were the Buddhas, his passions were reborn in the Brahmā realm.”
ai-mil5.5.6:6.3_0: “Good, sir, would you agree with such a dragon?”
ai-mil5.5.6:7.1_0: The sixth enquiry is the sixth section for recitation.
